field.name: summary
field.value: Binding to settings in dictionary with support for . as property accessor

field.name: description
field.value: A binder for IDictionary and IDictionary<,>, but right now it’s not selectable from the default DataBinder instance in castle which it should be, which also causes more complex field-names to fail to be bound, e.g. “myclass.Property.Dictionary[secondKey]” which it should support.

comment.author: roelofb
comment.text: Henrik Feldt submitted this on the list, but doesn't feel like creating an issue for this like everybody else does. This is a little one-time service from me.

comment.author: jsimons
jsimons
comment.text: We have survived with this limitation for a long time and it was never raised as a bug. I don't actually see the point of it. So unless someone gives me a good use case for it, I'm closing this issue.

comment.author: jsimons
comment.text: If anyone thinks this would be a good addition, please feel free to reopen it.

comment.author: jsimons
comment.text: * '''Resolution''' set to ''Won't Fix''. * '''Version Fixed''' set to ''2.0''. * '''Status''' changed from ''Work Stopped'' to ''Resolved''.
